===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|きょう}}
{{IPAchar|/keu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kjoː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=きょう|教|tr={{IPAchar|/kˠau/}}||to teach, to instruct}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|きょう}}

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|きょう|hhira=けう}}

# [[teaching]]

=====Usage notes=====
Only used in kanji compounds.  Never used in isolation with this reading.

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|きょう|hhira=けう}}

# [[-ism]] {{gloss|religion}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|さとし}}
From either the classical {{m|ja|終止形|tr=shūshikei||terminal form}} ''satoshi'' of modern adjective {{m|ja|聡い|tr=satoi||clever, sharp-witted}}, or the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} ''satoshi'' of cognate verb {{m|ja|諭す|tr=satosu||to admonish, persuade, remonstrate → to redirect into a smarter direction}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|さとし}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|さとし}}

# {{given name|lang=ja|sort=さとし|male}}
